sentences: Johanne Morissette Daug Amon-Lamar (born June 2, 1996), known professionally as Morissette, is a Filipina singer, songwriter, producer and former actress.
section: N/A

sentences: She first rose to prominence when she was the runner-up on TV5's Star Factor at the age of 14.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2012, she made her professional stage debut in the Repertory Philippines stage adaptation of Disney's Camp Rock in the role of Mitchie Torres.
section: N/A

sentences: She competed in the first season of ABS-CBN's The Voice of the Philippines in 2013, where she became part of Sarah Geronimo's team.
section: N/A

sentences: Morissette was born and raised in Minglanilla, Cebu.
section: N/A

sentences: She became part of ABS-CBN' s Sunday afternoon show, ASAP in January 2014, and was introduced as one of the "Homegrown Divas", which ultimately became ASAP's "Birit Queens".
section: N/A

sentences: She became a recording artist of Star Music in early 2014 and released her first album, titled Morissette, in March 2015.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2017 she was called "The Next Big Diva".
section: N/A

sentences: Morissette has often been referred to as "Asia's Phoenix" since her performance at the 14th Asia Song Festival in Busan, South Korea, on September 24, 2017, where she represented the Philippines.

sentences: She returned to the same festival to represent the Philippines at the 15th Asia Song Festival in Busan on October 3, 2018.
section: N/A

sentences: She was the first Filipino artist to have her own V Live channel, a popular South Korean live video streaming service for celebrities.
section: N/A

sentences: Morissette debuted on Pandora Predictions Chart, and on December 22, 2020, she debuted at number 7 on the Billboard Next Big Sound chart, making her the first-female OPM artist to do so.

== Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Johanne Morissette Daug Amon, also known as Morissette, was born on June 2, 1996, in Cebu City, Philippines, to her mother Analie Daug and father Amay Amon.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: She is the oldest child and has one sibling, Jeremy Mattheu Amon.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: She studied at Immaculate Heart of Mary Academy in Minglanilla, Cebu.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Her father is a rock musician.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Her name "Johanne", which is pronounced as "Yohan", was coined by her father from German composer Johann Sebastian Bach, while "Morissette" was taken from her father's favorite singer, Alanis Morissette.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: She was 3 years old when her family discovered her talent in singing.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: When she was left alone with a karaoke machine, she sang the Regine Velasquez song, "You Are My Song".
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: As she grew up, she sang Jessa Zaragoza songs like "Paano Kaya".
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: In her first singing contest held by a radio station in Cebu, she sang Christina Aguilera's "Reflection".
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Thereafter she became a frequent singing contestant in Cebu, joining competitions such as Young Star Singing Idol.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: At 9 years of age, she became a finalist in the Little Division of Little Big Star Cebu.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: She also did front acts in mall tours for different artists like Sarah Geronimo and Kim Chiu, among others, in Cebu.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Morissette is known to execute a whistle register and expressed she got this inspiration from another Filipina singer Nina Girado.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Growing up, her other musical influences include Regine Velasquez and Sarah Geronimo.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: At the age of 14, she competed on TV5's Talentadong Pinoy and immediately exit the competition but was highly endorsed by the chairman of the board of judges to join an upcoming reality star search.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: She then entered a production deal with production team Muller and Patton (Jaye Muller, Ben Patton) to record 14 songs written by them for Morissette.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Those songs were not then released officially but appeared as pirate releases online; they were later officially released in two volumes on November 20, 2020 and March 21, 2021.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: After Talentadong Pinoy, Morissette then was asked to join the new Artista Search of TV5, the Star Factor.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Because of her strong desire to become a singer and performer, she auditioned in Cebu, where the judges picked her as one of the finalists.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: She then moved to Manila together with her mother to compete in the finals.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: She reached the top 4 and then was the first runner-up to Eula Caballero, the Star Factor winner.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Talent manager David Cosico offered to manage her career on TV5.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: She eventually appeared in several TV5 shows, such as Kapitan Awesome and Cassandra: Warrior Angel.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: In 2012, Morissette auditioned for the Repertory Philippines production of Disney's Camp Rock: The Musical and scored the lead role of Mitchie Torres.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: The musical ran at Onstage, Greenbelt 1, Makati City from November 16 until December 16, 2012.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Rehearsing and performing in the musical took its toll on Morisette's voice, and she was diagnosed her with vocal cord nodules.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: Morissette's last project at TV5 was Cassandra: Warrior Angel.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2012: Career beginnings and TV5's Star Factor ===

sentences: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Her work at TV5 supported her family financially, but Morissette wanted to pursue a singing career.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She decided to join ABS-CBN's new singing competition, The Voice of the Philippines.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: During the blind auditions, Morissette sang "Love On Top"; and with her strong vocals she instantly made it to be part of Team Sarah Geronimo.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She progressed into the live shows, as Geronimo chose her over teammate Lecelle Trinidad when they both sang "No More Tears (Enough Is Enough)" during the Battle Rounds.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: During the first live show of The Voice of the Philippines Morissette sang "Jar of Hearts".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She received the highest percentage of votes in Geronimo's team, with 57.16%, and advanced to the next level of the competition.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: For the second live show, Morissette sang "What About Love", and Geronimo picked her over former South Border member Maki Ricafort, scoring her 60% for her performance.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Added to her public vote of 50.41% her total score of 110.41 points advanced her to the next round.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: During the semi-finals, she sang Jessie J's "Who You Are", losing to teammate Klarisse De Guzman, and was eliminated.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Morissette went on to make TV guest appearances, mall tours, and other activities together with her fellow Voice of the Philippines contestants.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She was often compared with her mentor, Sarah Geronimo, whom she was said to resemble.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Morissette initially felt hurt by the comparisons, but came to consider them an honor, realizing that she needed establish her own identity.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: In 2014 Morissette started recurring appearances on ABS-CBN's ASAP.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: For the drama series Moon of Desire, she recorded the self-titled theme song by Trina Belamide.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: This was followed by more theme songs on ABS-CBN's "teleseryes".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Together with her former teammate from The Voice of the Philippines, De Guzman and Angeline Quinto, she was given a segment on ASAP called "HD" or "Homegrown Divas".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She also started performing in It's Showtime, ABS-CBN's noontime variety show, where she was allowed to sing solo numbers.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: This show provided Morissette an opportunity to demonstrate both her singing and dancing skills.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She was accused of lip-syncing Ariana Grande's "Break Free" after the hosts of the show praised her for keeping her voice steady while dancing across the stage.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Morissette denied the accusation.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: In May 2014, Morissette gave her first solo concert entitled This Is Me, which doubled as her 18th birthday celebration.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Her repertoire included international pop hits, as well as those from Philippine singers such as Regine Velasquez.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She even paid homage to her namesake by singing her own versions of Alanis Morissette's "Ironic" and "You Learn".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: During this concert she announced that she had joined Star Records, with which she signed a one-year contract in August 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Morissette had the opportunity to perform with Jessie J at her concert on July 14, 2014, at Smart Araneta Coliseum.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She was interviewing Jessie J for the music channel Myx and mentioned that she sang one of her songs on The Voice of the Philippines.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Jessie J then requested Morissette to sing for her, and Morissette sang part of "Who You Are".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: Jessie J immediately invited Morissette to join her onstage during her concert.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: In September 2014, Morissette performed in the 2014 finals of Himig Handog P-Pop Love Songs, the country's most popular songwriting and music video competition.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: The Voice of the Philippines and transfer to ABS-CBN ===

sentences: She interpreted "Akin Ka Na Lang", an original song written by Francis Louis "Kiko" Salazar which was chosen as one of the 15 finalists out of more than 6,000 entries submitted since November 2013.

== Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP =
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===
== Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: In January 2020, Morissette was awarded as the first-ever Wish 107.5 Hall of Famer.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: In late November 2020, Morissette released her first co-written and co-produced single “Love You Still” through Underdog Music PH.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: Co-written with her husband (then fiancé) Dave Lamar and co-produced with Dave Lamar and Xergio Ramos, the song was in English in recognition of Morissette's growing international fan base and to help promote OPM (Original Pilipino Music) around the world.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: In early December 2020, a music video for "Love You Still" was released.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: And within four weeks of its release, "Love You Still" charted in 12 countries including the U.S. and U.K. Morissette debuted on Pandora Predictions Chart, and on December 22, 2020, she debuted at number 7 on the Billboard Next Big Sound chart, making her the first-ever female OPM artist to do so.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: On February 19, 2021, Morissette released her second co-written and co-produced single "Phoenix" through Underdog Music PH.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: It was also co-written with Dave Lamar and co-produced with Dave Lamar and Xergio Ramos.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: Within 30 minutes of its release, it debuted at number 3 on the iTunes Philippines Chart and soon thereafter it became her first co-written original song to hit number 1 on that chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: A day later, she released a music video for "Phoenix".

sentences: It was made by the same team as the "Love You Still" video.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: In May 2021, Morissette released her official recording of "Shine" in celebration of the song's silver anniversary.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: The timely release was a re-introduction of "Shine's" original lyrics composed by multi-awarded songwriter Trina Belamide who joined forces with Star Music to reproduce the well-loved composition originally sung by Ima Castro and later rendered by Regine Velasquez.

sentences: In August 2021, Morissette released her debut EP Signature with her lead single "Trophy".
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: This was her first EP as a singer-songwriter and co-producer along with Lamar and Ramos and was released under Stages Sessions' label Underdog PH.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: In October 2021, Morissette became part of the Christian music label from Sony Music Philippines, Waterwalk Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: She then released her first single from that record label, which is "WATERWALK," written by Jungee Marcelo.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: Morissette celebrated her 10th anniversary in the industry through a virtual concert titled "Phoenix" that was held on KTX on January 23-24, 2022.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020–present: Hall of Famer at Wish Music Awards, move to new label, and Signature EP ===

sentences: The concert highlights the young diva's growth as a performer through the years.

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Morissette Amon and Dave Lamar were married on June 28, 2021.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Leading up to their marriage, on December 21, 2020, Morissette wrote on Instagram, "More than just an 11:11 wish, you're an answered prayer.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: I love you @davejlamar, always have and always will".
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Morissette, when 24, said that the proposal happened a few months ago, with friends and family the first to know.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: "Nine years since we've met, bestfriends for seven, our second round at love, each other's firsts... and now, last and only...
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: It's definitely a Y E S to a forever with you!"
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: she added.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Morissette and Dave were both on The Voice of the Philippines Season 1 in 2013.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They married in 2021, which Amon captioned on their wedding video "“We are so happy to finally officially announce that WE ARE MARRIED!

== Vocal profile ==

sentences: Vocal profile ==
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: One of Morissette's most distinctive vocal features is her ability to sing in the whistle register with ease.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: Morissette revealed in an interview that Mariah Carey served as an inspiration to develop her talent in whistling, and to date she has done numerous performances of Mariah's songs.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: To showcase her talent, Morissette occasionally adds whistle notes when doing covers, and songs from her debut album also include whistles.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: Another distinctive feature is her use of intentional vocal breaks, which sound like high-pitched squeaks.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: This technique is used by some singers to add expression to their singing.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: She is an admirer of the vocal performances of Mariah Carey as a female singer who she is inspired by.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: Morissette has also spoken of Shoshana Bean and Cynthia Erivo as being influences on her vocal style.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: She is also influenced by her appreciation of gospel vocalists such as Chandler Moore of Maverick City and Tasha Cobbs.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: Cast as one of ASAP's "Birit" Queens (literally "Belter" Queens), most of her performances revolve around songs that require belting.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: This has led her to being described as a power belter.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: However, Morissette has admitted that she wants to go beyond her stereotype as a belter, and has taken some opportunities to do so by performing songs not usually identified with her, such as in her debut solo concert and her Stages Sessions mini-concert.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: Jonathan Manalo, the head of Star Records' audio content, has been quoted as saying "Morissette is not just like any traditional diva who can hit high notes.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: She has a very distinct tone that can adapt to many music genres.
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: And that versatility is something that we will showcase in her debut album with us".
section: == Vocal profile ==

sentences: It was during the process of creating her debut album when Morissette's record company discovered that aside from belting she had the ability to whistle and asked her to include it in the album.
section: == Vocal profile ==
